Sadly though I agree with most of the comments about the baby car seat etc., has anyone seen this law being enforced in Sri Lanka or any publicity given to baby car seats in Sri Lanka anywhere? Its easy to criticize, but unless you have been abroad and seen use and safety of car seats, most parents are unaware that there is something like this, even if it is available, it must be advertised. Our commercial organizations go to town marketing anything and everything as long as there is a demand for it and for the demand to arise the need for the particular goods must be there and for the need to be prevalent the common man must be informed about it, by the authorities concerned. If the use of a baby car seat or a childrens helmet were made mandatory, the suppliers will go to town importing these from not only from China from Timbuctoo even to make a fast buck. No parent wants to put their children irrespective of age at risk and though every parent may not be lucky enough to be a Chemist or a Physicist, the simple folk living in most part of the country think their children are safest in their laps or arms, that is human nature and parental love and not because they know Newton's Law or any other big scientific theory.
